intro: Ageratum conyzoides subsp. houstonianum, commonly known as Mexican sage, is a flowering plant native to Central America and the Caribbean. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring bushy foliage and clusters of small, showy flowers. The flowers are usually blue, purple, or white, and they bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The plant is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of natural dyes.
